### Prerequisites

- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

I've installed PowerShell as a global tool with .NET 6 in an Alpine 3.15 container. When attempting to run `pwsh`, it results in the following error:

```
 ---> System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'. The system cannot find the file specified.

File name: 'Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at System.Management.Automation.PSObject.get_Properties()

   at Microsoft.PowerShell.ConsoleHost.DoRunspaceInitialization(Boolean skipProfiles, String initialCommand, String configurationName, Collection`1 initialCommandArgs)

   at Microsoft.PowerShell.ConsoleHost.Start(String bannerText, String helpText)

```

Repro Steps:

1. Build the following Dockerfile (e.g. `docker build -t test .`):

```Dockerfile
FROM alpine:3.15

RUN apk add --no-cache \
        ca-certificates \
        \
        # .NET dependencies
        icu-libs \
        krb5-libs \
        libgcc \
        libintl \
        libssl1.1 \
        libstdc++ \
        zlib

# Install .NET SDK
RUN wget -O dotnet.tar.gz https://dotnetcli.blob.core.windows.net/dotnet/Sdk/6.0.100/dotnet-sdk-6.0.100-linux-musl-x64.tar.gz \
    && mkdir -p /usr/share/dotnet \
    && tar -C /usr/share/dotnet -oxzf dotnet.tar.gz \
    && ln -s /usr/share/dotnet/dotnet /usr/bin/dotnet

# Install PowerShell
RUN dotnet tool install --global PowerShell

ENTRYPOINT [ "/root/.dotnet/tools/pwsh" ]
```

2. Run the container (e.g. `docker run --rm test`)

### Expected behavior

```console
A successful execution into the shell of PowerShell
```

comments.author: mthalman
comments.body:
> I was installing pwsh7.2 (without sdk) on alpine3.15, using official instructions:

So you're installing directly from the tarball? Yes, that works. What doesn't work is installing as a global tool from the .NET SDK. The PowerShell deployment types are different between the two. The tarball contains a self-contained deployment of PowerShell while installing as a global tool is a framework-dependent deployment.

comments.author: mthalman
comments.body: @adityapatwardhan - We'd like to be able to ship .NET official container images for Alpine 3.15 for the February servicing release. But that depends on this being fixed. Is there enough time to get this addressed by then?

The loading issue is related to .NET 6 missing RID for Alpine 3.15. Issue tracking it: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/pull/62938

the change needs to go back to .NET 6.
